Create exercise selector component:

title: FormAnalyzer: Multi-exercise support
description: Transform SwingAnalyzer into a generic FormAnalyzer supporting multiple exercises (kettlebell swings, pull-ups, pistol squats) through a pluggable exercise definition architecture. See docs/FORM_ANALYZER_PROPOSAL.md for full design.

title: Phase 1: Create exercise definition configs
description:
Create src/exercises/ with:
- kettlebellSwing.ts - port existing swing logic to config
- pullUp.ts - new definition
- pistolSquat.ts - new definition
- index.ts - registry/factory for exercises

title: Phase 4: E2E tests for exercise selection
description:
Add E2E tests:
- Exercise selection flow
- Verify filmstrip updates per exercise
- Rep counting for each exercise type

title: Fix filmstrip thumbnails during extraction (frameImage pass-through)
description:
Filmstrip thumbnails show frame 0 instead of actual swing positions during extraction.

Root cause: SwingFormProcessor.captureCurrentFrame() reads from main video element which is paused at frame 0 during extraction.

Fix: Pass frameImage (ImageData) from PoseExtractor through the pipeline so thumbnails capture the correct frame.
design:
1. Add frameImage?: ImageData to PoseTrackFrame (runtime-only, not serialized)
2. Add frameImage?: ImageData to FrameEvent interface
3. Capture ImageData in PoseExtractor after drawing frame to canvas
4. Pass through buildSkeletonEventFromFrame()
5. Use in SwingFormProcessor.captureCurrentFrame() if available
6. Create shared skeleton drawing utility for thumbnail overlay
acceptance_criteria:
- Extraction shows correct thumbnails at each swing position
- Thumbnails include skeleton overlay
- Memory: frameImage cleared after thumbnail creation
- PoseTrack JSON does not include frameImage (stripped on serialize)

title: Create shared skeleton drawing utility
description: Extract skeleton rendering logic to a shared utility that can be used by both SkeletonRenderer and SwingFormProcessor (for thumbnail overlays).
design:
Create src/utils/skeletonDrawing.ts with:
- drawSkeletonToContext(ctx, skeleton, options)
- SkeletonDrawOptions interface (keypointRadius, lineWidth, colors)
- Refactor SkeletonRenderer to use this utility
acceptance_criteria:
- New utility file created
- SkeletonRenderer refactored to use it
- SwingFormProcessor can draw skeleton on thumbnails
- No code duplication for skeleton rendering

title: Phase 3: Update filmstrip for dynamic positions
description:
Update filmstrip component:
- Display position names from exercise config
- Show angle info for current exercise
- Handle different number of positions per exercise

title: Phase 4: Unit tests for FormAnalyzer and RepCounter
description:
Add unit tests:
- FormAnalyzer with each exercise config
- RepCounter sequence validation
- Angle calculations for new methods
- Exercise config validation

title: Phase 2: Update Pipeline/PipelineFactory for exercise selection
description:
Update src/pipeline/PipelineFactory.ts:
- Accept exercise type parameter
- Instantiate correct analyzer based on exercise
- Pass ExerciseDefinition to FormAnalyzer

title: Fix duplicate rep counting on playback (playback-only mode)
description:
Playing video after extraction counts reps again, doubling the count.

Root cause: Playback pipeline still runs SwingFormProcessor and SwingRepProcessor, re-detecting positions and re-counting reps.

Fix: Add playback-only mode that skips form/rep processing entirely.
design:
Option B (simpler): Add playbackOnly flag to Pipeline constructor.

1. Add playbackOnly: boolean parameter to Pipeline
2. When true, start() skips form/rep processing stages
3. Only emits skeleton events for rendering
4. PipelineFactory auto-sets playbackOnly=true when using cached poses
acceptance_criteria:
- Load video, wait for extraction (e.g., 3 reps detected)
- Play video to end
- Rep count stays at 3 (not 6)
- Skeleton still renders during playback
- Angle displays still update during playback

title: Optimize E2E test performance
description: Tests take 2+ minutes. Optimizations: 1) Remove 10ms frame delay (saves ~8s/test), 2) Use smaller fixtures (2 reps vs 8), 3) Move IndexedDB seeding to beforeAll. Branch: feature/e2e-test-optimizations
notes: Completed: Changed frame delay default from 10ms to 0ms. With 796 frames, this saves ~8s per test that uses mock extraction. Tests pass in isolation; parallel flakiness is tracked separately in swing-mt5.

title: Phase 1: Add elbow and generic angle methods to Skeleton
description:
Add to src/models/Skeleton.ts:
- getElbowAngle() - for pull-ups
- getGenericAngle(a, b, c) - configurable 3-point angle calculation

title: Fix 7 failing E2E tests
description: 4 instant-filmstrip failures (rep counting), 1 swing-analyzer failure (hardcoded video load), 2 user-journey failures (video source blob: vs swing-sample.webm). These existed before our changes.

title: Phase 2: Create generic RepCounter

- Support different rep definitions per exercise

title: Run PR review agent before merging DebugTab changes
